story.text:
I see the path to this through creating partnerships. I had a discussion with a language school based in the US yesterday - the explicitly mentioned Urdu as a focus. The "WCS Translation project" should involve our contact working with translation and Wikipedia, and other such interested parties.

As with everything - I am proposing taking the task of what we need to build and turning it into a WCS Study Group - that is applying the p2p methodology radically to our own internal practice.

In the case of translation it would be something like:

1) Convene a group with energy around translation issues. In this case the "Speaking in Tongues" proto- group  described earlier with deaf community, software developers, and indigenous language

2) Run a time limited set of workshops with the group. Explore software tools, build community, look for funding in the course / workshops

3) Award a WCS Certificate in "Translation / Diversity" and require participants to pay back their learning by teaching what they have leraned or by other ways of supporting WCS.

So basically I hope to get the transcription and translation aspect tackled over the next 12 weeks by getting a group together looking at how we work with video and translation - I'm thinking of calling this at the moment the Many Voices course.
